website_summaries.verdict: The Peanut is a surprisingly resilient rubber chew toy for medium and large breeds, with the Weenut for small breeds, and it’s an excellent choice for outdoor playtime.
pros: Made of puncture-proof solid rubber that floats if dropped in water
Available in a rainbow of neon colors
Bouncy, gentle on teeth and gums
cons: You can’t choose your favorite color when you order online

customer_reviews.title: My dogs LOVE these peanuts
customer_reviews.text: My dogs LOVE these peanuts! I have purchased several of them over the years with different smells/flavors. They have been in the extreme winter weather for extended periods of time under the snow, they have been in the mud, they have been chewed on repeatedly and played tug of war with between the 2 dogs and they hold up better than any other dog product on the market (well there are 3 other products that are equally as wonderful but that's another review). Even after washing these things in the dishwasher they still retain their scent. I highly recommend this product.
customer_reviews.author: Lj

customer_reviews.title: Only lasted for about two months, but smells awesome and was entertaining for a while
customer_reviews.text: Purchased June 10 and so far so good! They aren't as obsessed with it as some other toys, but that's probably because they haven't found a way to destroy it yet :) I also love the strawberry smell of the pink one! Sometimes their breath even smells like it which is a pleasant change. "They" is a 85 pound German Shepherd and a Boston-Pug mix, both avid chewers and destroyers of anything they can get their mouths around. Updated 8/31/15 - The Boston-Pug mix eventually found a way to chew off pieces of it. Lasted longer than many other toys, but alas, not indestructible. Dropping to 4 stars.
customer_reviews.author: towen

customer_reviews.title: Paw-fect Toy
customer_reviews.text: My almost 2 year old Goldendoodle exclusively likes plush and soft toys. I’m not sure that I smell the peanut butter scent, but maybe he can because he is obsessed with this. The shape and material seem to be a winner with him. We’ve owned it for about one month, and it’s survived any attempted destruction. It’s a thick, but flexible material, which makes it bouncy and easier to carry than a Kong or similar product.
customer_reviews.author: Jennifer F

customer_reviews.title: My Standard Poodle Loves It!
customer_reviews.text: Worthy is a big boy and can chew things to pieces. A lot of toys have become off-limits because we don't want him swallowing pieces. But chewing is so good for dogs. So we keep trying to find things that work. This one is a WINNER! He loves it! He takes it outside all the time. He chews on it frequently. Of course it looks adorable extending out both sides of his mouth! We got a yellow one. I wish I could pick colors. I'd love to have an orange one, and I like getting him multiples of toys he likes that are safe for him. I want him to be able to easily find the toy he wants!
customer_reviews.author: K. Davis

customer_reviews.title: Dogs like it. Still in one piece. I'm satisfied.
customer_reviews.text: This is a really squishy/slippery rubber. Probably not as indestructible as a long, but it seems to be holding up really well to my dogs. Maybe not the best toy for the strongest chewers. The openings on the end are not really big enough to make this toy stuff-able which was disappointing. My dog loves it though and it is peanut flavored. I got the neon green one, but would have preferred the yellow.
customer_reviews.author: Jaime

customer_reviews.title: Great toy!
customer_reviews.text: This toy has become one of my dog's favorite toys. While he is usually a pretty aggressive chewer, this toy has lasted nearly a year and is still in great condition. He just seems to love to chomp down on it and let go, only to do it over and over again. For some reason he doesn't show any interest in shredding it like many other toys. It has lasted much longer than some of the other Ruff Dawg toys we purchased. I would order this again without hesitation.
customer_reviews.author: pj

customer_reviews.title: Sturdy toy but not for aggressive chewers
customer_reviews.text: I have a 90 pound young Malinois and we have a ruff dog peanut that he grew up with. After about a year of tugging and mouthing it he put a slit in the middle of it but the rubber is so thick that it still has not broken. I bought a new one as back up as it’s his favorite toy. I’m sure an aggressive chewer would find a way through the thick rubber but I think part of the reason it’s still going is it’s pliability when he tugs.
customer_reviews.author: DLT

customer_reviews.title: Great dog toy
customer_reviews.text: We have a goldendudel and this is the first toy he has not been able to rip apart. It is some what soft, but tough. He loves it.
customer_reviews.author: Kindle customer,  The first book was a good read, the second starts to drag along and third not so g

customer_reviews.title: Nutty, but quiet, fun
customer_reviews.text: Our beagle, who easily destroys so-called "indestructable" toys, has not damaged the peanut at all and he absolutely LOVES it. He likes to carry it around, chase it, and bounce it to get kibble treats out of it. Because of its irregular shape, the peanut bounces in a very unpredictable way, which keeps the canine guessing...and the humans laughing. Best of all, the peanut is quiet on hardwood floors! (Some treat-dispensing toys are so loud that the kids beg me not to let the dog play with them.) The peanut is hit with everyone.
customer_reviews.author: K8

customer_reviews.title: great for a big dog only.
customer_reviews.text: I ordered this for a medium size dog and was surprised how large this toy is. The treat opening is small but it falls into a hollow inside and unless your dog has large jaw to grind the hidden treat he wont get the treat out. It definately smells sweet and similar to peanut butter. The toy does bounce well and is made well; Colors vary and you don't know what Color you will get. I got orange and it stands out well in the grass but I would only recommend this toy for large dogs only.
customer_reviews.author: 30donnam

customer_reviews.title: BUY THESE !!!
customer_reviews.text: Ruff Dawg toys are THE BEST !!! This one smells like peanut butter...yummy...even after floating around the pool a lot. My PIT can't even put a mark on these toys. I have 3 because they fight over them. I own two big destructive dogs and these are indestructible...HIGHLY RECOMMEND !!! You won't be disappointed.
customer_reviews.author: dutchiemom

customer_reviews.title: My English Bulldog Sherman LOVES his peanut!
customer_reviews.text: My English Bulldog Sherman LOVES this thing. He uses it as a pacifier. Some times he tries to use it for tug of war, but we try to have him only use it for relaxation. He props it up between his two paws, puts it against the rough of his mouth and starts sucking on it like a baby with a pacifier. It's adorabully! His first one lasted 2 years. We just re-ordered one from Amazon to save a bunch of money. $8.99 on here, $19.99 at the local pet store. A no brainer!
customer_reviews.author: DigitallyBranded

customer_reviews.title: soft rubber dog toy
customer_reviews.text: Well this really is not really a chew toy, it's made of a very soft rubber material. Dogs like chasing after it because it bounces funny from weird shape and it's very light and doesn't hurt if thrown accidentally at the dog. It has a hole on one side, you can not stuff it with treats like a Kong. A few hard bites and rips this thing is gone, but my dog just tends to mouth the toy, carry it around, but then loses interest fast if you are not throwing or playing with it also.
customer_reviews.author: D. Kan

customer_reviews.title: Not for aggressive chewers
customer_reviews.text: This didn't even make it 5 minutes with my retriever mix :( she is 70 pounds and one year old so I would definitely consider her an aggressive chewer. Although it was too large for my Pomeranian I think it would have lasted him a couple months. Cute idea, but the hole at the top made it to easy to pick apart.
customer_reviews.author: StarryKnightFox

customer_reviews.title: Highly recommend!
customer_reviews.text: My dog loves this! It's durable, great for tossing, just teething on, or stuffing with treats. Lots of options with this. Since it's silicone, it doesn't have that awful rubber smell. Highly recommend.
customer_reviews.author: Christine B.

customer_reviews.title: Indestructable!!!
customer_reviews.text: Our 90 lb Pitbull mix can destroy every dog toy on the market except for the Ruff Dawg Peanut. The Peanut is made from rubber not plastic. He loves it. We put treats inside and he crushes the Peanut with his jaws and breaks the treat inside so that he can tilt it up and shake the pieces out into his mouth.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: dogs favorite toy
customer_reviews.text: I use it in the pool and they just love them, they last along time and they float really well, I have had 4 of them
customer_reviews.author: Di

customer_reviews.title: Fantastic Dog Toy! Give it a try!
customer_reviews.text: We have a one year old terrier mix who has destroyed most of his other toys. This is made a soft material, but for some reason he hasn't destroyed it and plays with it all day. Fantastic value as far as dog toys are concerned. Also, has a vanilla smell that hasn't gone away for months! His favorite toy by far.
customer_reviews.author: JSIL

customer_reviews.title: Great Toy!
customer_reviews.text: I love the Ruff Dawg Peanut Rubber dog toy. I have an Australian Cattle Dog and this is one of her favorite toys. She manages to tear apart many other toys which are supposed to stand up to typical dog abuse but not the Peanut... not yet at least. I also have a Ruff Dawg Stick which she loves and the Wee-nut which is just a smaller version of the Peanut. I actually prefer the Wee-nut because it is easier for her to catch. Play time for the dog is very important because the Australian Cattle Dog is very active and it just so happens now that all of the toys she mainly plays with are made by Ruff Dawg.
customer_reviews.author: John D. Razan

customer_reviews.title: Not durable
customer_reviews.text: Our dog managed to chew off a piece within 20 minutes of getting the Peanut. We were disappointed that it just wasn't as durable as it was described to be. He is a Kong kind of dog, so we were hoping this would give him something of a different option to play with. Sadly, no.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Great toy!
customer_reviews.text: My dogs love this little peanut! I have rotties and they just like to hold it in their mouth and run around
customer_reviews.author: Alyssa Marie

customer_reviews.title: This is a very good product, but unfortunately our dog doesn't have much ...
customer_reviews.text: This is a very good product, but unfortunately our dog doesn't have much interest in it (unless another dog is paying attention). I tried putting food in it, like her Kong, but it was too big and she couldn't get a proper chewing grip to get the food out. I was happy with the quality, scent, and that it was made in the USA. I liked that there are no chewable seams either for her to get in and destroy it.
customer_reviews.author: Michelle Jackson

customer_reviews.title: Best dog toy out there
customer_reviews.text: Our dog can chew up anything, anything but this that is.
customer_reviews.author: Brian Fitting

customer_reviews.title: Pit bull-proof!
customer_reviews.text: Our pit bull destroys toys within minutes - even "indestructible" ones. We've had this peanut for 3 months now and it shows no signs of wear. He loves it! It's great for playing fetch inside the house too since it's a soft rubber. It bounces in unpredictable ways and is super fun for both the dog and his humans. Smells great, too!
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: My lab cannot destroy!!!
customer_reviews.text: We have three if these for our 105lb Black Lab. They are the only toys that he cannot destroy! Best yet, they float and are great in the pool. Love this product!!! (Sorry about the foot in the picture!)
customer_reviews.author: T. Kath

customer_reviews.title: Bummer
customer_reviews.text: Lasted about 15min with my 80lb sweetheart of a Golden.
customer_reviews.author: R. Mayhew

customer_reviews.title: My dog loves this. We insert a treat and ...
customer_reviews.text: My dog loves this. We insert a treat and give it to him every time we leave the house. He no longer whines if he doesn't get to go with us.
customer_reviews.author: j

customer_reviews.title: New favorite!
customer_reviews.text: My new labrador destroys toys that survived even the previous lab! This one is great! Softish but doesn't tear. I fill it with biscuits and he happily crunches it so the smaller pieces fall out. He loves it and I love when he is not chewing my shoes and electronics. Many toys tried and failed, this one's a keeper.
customer_reviews.author: Jamie

customer_reviews.title: softer rubber than I anticipated
customer_reviews.text: I guess I expected this to be a harder peanut to crack. It's a soft, forgiving rubber, which might be the only reason it's still in one piece, although my dog loves nothing more than a toy that gives in easily to her tearing teeth. I take it away as soon as she empties it. Smells nice.
customer_reviews.author: texypants

customer_reviews.title: A favorite
customer_reviews.text: Because of its soft texture, I didn't expect this toy to survive my golden puppy's destructive ways. To my surprise, after 5 months, it's still in perfect shape. She has managed to destroy many toys meant for strong chewers so I was happily surprised. Even when the two dogs play tug, it holds up. And it's a favorite - she knows her "peanut" by name.
customer_reviews.author: Joanne V

customer_reviews.title: most toys go straight to the garbage. She carries these around and constantly brings them ...
customer_reviews.text: Our dog has two peanuts and two wee-nuts. These are the ONLY toys that she has not been able to chew through or rip to shreds in a matter of minutes - and she is extremely aggressive with very focused chewing/gnawing; most toys go straight to the garbage. She carries these around and constantly brings them to us to play tug/keep-a-way/fetch. The peanuts have lasted well over a year and show no signs of wear. I wish this company would put out more products in this same material...they have been a miracle in our house!
customer_reviews.author: ParkerD

customer_reviews.title: My Dog Really Loves this Nut
customer_reviews.text: My Golden Retriever is obsessed with soft rubber toys (and I prefer the ones that don't squeak) so this is perfect. You can drop a treat in there and he's entertained for quite some time. He hasn't tried to destroy or chew it (he just likes carrying them around in his mouth) so I can't comment on if this is good for dogs that like to destroy.
customer_reviews.author: Amos

customer_reviews.title: Ruff Dawg Peanut
customer_reviews.text: My dog Woody is a rambunctious, full of energy 24/7 3 yr old Chocolate Lab and powerful chewer. Ruff Dawg Toys are the only toys that can withstand his wrath and the only toys that I will buy!! We have hours of fun playing fetch with his peanut....he LOVES this thing!! The peanut is not as thick as other Ruff Dawg toys, so I don't let him out of my site when playing with the peanut. Even though it is pretty tough, I'm sure that if Woody had a few hours to himself with peanut....it would have some damage. If you have a dog that will destroy most toys in seconds.....Ruff Dawg Toys are the way to go!!
customer_reviews.author: The Candle Lady

customer_reviews.title: Not that durable.
customer_reviews.text: My dogs loved it but it only lasted about 10 minutes before one of them was ripping chunks off. Granted, my dogs destroy most toys quickly but this is certainly not very durable. Overall, in terms of durability, it's definitely on the lower end of chews I've given them.
customer_reviews.author: J.M.

customer_reviews.title: Great dog toy
customer_reviews.text: My dogs both love this toy, our heeler is really hard on toys but this is our second one. It stretches,flexes and make a good tug of war or fetch toy. The only thing I can say is we received the red one and it has a rather strong smell, more like an odd Vanilla than anything.
customer_reviews.author: GSP

customer_reviews.title: fun toy for my dogs
customer_reviews.text: My two dogs love this peanut toy so much that I had to order a second one so their would be no jealously between them. I have tough chewers and so far these peanut toys have stood up to the test. They also like the way they bounce around on the floor when I throw them for them to chase.
customer_reviews.author: Pamela Bryant

customer_reviews.title: Get your peanut!  Whos got tha peanut?!?
customer_reviews.text: What the hell are these made of???!? Still in like new condition. My boys destroy everything else. Hard to get peanut butter in but they love them either way and have lasted 8+ months. Unheard of here.
customer_reviews.author: Joseph McGuinness (Ray Ray's Records)

customer_reviews.title: Tuff toy!
customer_reviews.text: None of my terriers or Dalmatians could chew this up. Loaded it with small treats (Charlie Bears) and the treats fell out rapidly. Then I used larger treats and the toy kept them busy for quite awhile. Highly recommend it for toy destroyers as this is very tuff.
customer_reviews.author: Ardith Dahlstrom

customer_reviews.title: Okay for small treats
customer_reviews.text: Dog walks away after frustrated and small treats stuck inside rot. My whippet puppy can be entertained and mused for a long time, but not with this toy. I think it's because treats don't come out even after playing a long time.
customer_reviews.author: kimadina

customer_reviews.title: Durable
customer_reviews.text: This is the only toy that has lasted through our Labrador's chewing
customer_reviews.author: Robin McDonnell

customer_reviews.title: very durable
customer_reviews.text: I am so happy with this toy. My lab loves it. It smells like vanilla. When you get it you will be surprised that the material isn't very thick, however, my lab who can destroy most toys, hasn't been able to damage this one at all. He loves his peanut.
customer_reviews.author: ash

customer_reviews.title: He loves it!
customer_reviews.text: So fun for a thinking pup who likes a challenge
customer_reviews.author: Katherine d

customer_reviews.title: Recommended.
customer_reviews.text: This arrived well packed and fast! It is hollow and somewhat squeezable with a large and small hole in each end to dispense treats. I must say this seems to be one of our lab's all time favorites....RECOMMEND.
customer_reviews.author: Kit R.

customer_reviews.title: Dog loves it
customer_reviews.text: I have a big chewer on hand (ACD x puppy) and she loves this treat dispenser. She can chew/play for an hour. Keeps her entertained and treats dispense slowly, as opposed to other toys where the dog gets them all out in a matter of minutes. Still in one piece too!
customer_reviews.author: Ride

customer_reviews.title: Dogs Love It
customer_reviews.text: I have a small Terrier and a big Pit mix and they love this toy! I've put some kibble inside and they both play with it at the same time. Both of them can tear apart a lot of toys but this one is holding up after 4 months and constant use.
customer_reviews.author: Oxy Alum

customer_reviews.title: Well, I wish it had lasted longer than 5 ...
customer_reviews.text: Well, I wish it had lasted longer than 5 minutes. My dachshund had it in pieces almost immediately. He is a very strong chewer.
customer_reviews.author: Oscar

customer_reviews.title: best dog toy out there
customer_reviews.text: This is probably one of the best dog products made. My 1 yr old pitbull has had this for a few months and constantly chews on it and it still smells good and has no damage to it from her chewing. I honestly think this toy will remain in tact for years!
customer_reviews.author: notarockstar

customer_reviews.title: Great dog toy.
customer_reviews.text: Great product, my Jack Russell usually destroys toys but this one has really held up to his rough play. Soft enough to play catch with, firm enough too bounce.
customer_reviews.author: Flabio13

customer_reviews.title: Good for Labs
customer_reviews.text: Our labs LOVE their peanuts! And we have two 3 1/2 year old labs and they got their peanuts on Easter and they are still around so that is a GREAT sign that they are durable!
customer_reviews.author: T. MIreault

customer_reviews.title: The dogs LOVE it but I was definitely disappointed
customer_reviews.text: The dogs LOVE it but I was definitely disappointed. It didn't take 10 minutes for them to have one end cracked. It's a fun retrieving toy but not good for hiding treats.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Best dog toy ever!
customer_reviews.text: My dogs favorite toy! He chews through every toy I buy him, but not this one!
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Ruff ruff
customer_reviews.text: This a great toy for my Great Dane! He loves it. I like that it does not smell like other rubber toys, this one has a vanilla smell to it. Thank you, Ruff Dawg for making a great dog toy!!
customer_reviews.author: Holly

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: It smells good! and is so durable, a toy my dog will always love!
customer_reviews.author: Normandy Bernard

customer_reviews.title: Peanut treat toy
customer_reviews.text: Only 3 stars because I think it should last longer. I use this every night as a treat for my German Shepherd. It lasts about 2 months. I've bought about 4 of these and they are not cheap.
customer_reviews.author: DLH

customer_reviews.title: Only toy tough enough for my destructive dog.
customer_reviews.text: I don't know why, but this is the only toy that my blackmouth cur doesn't destroy in 15 minutes. They last about 3-4 months before he starts taking off chunks. I bought a lot to hold me over as they are getting hard to find. No one locally carries them anymore. Strongly recommend for anyone with an insane shredder toothed dog.
customer_reviews.author: WatchFan

customer_reviews.title: Dogs love
customer_reviews.text: So far dogs love this. I full it with dog kibble and then add peanut butter to the top. Keeps them busy for awhile.
customer_reviews.author: Launi

customer_reviews.title: My dogs love these and although no toy is indestructible
customer_reviews.text: My dogs love these and although no toy is indestructible, they are holding up well to one Golden and two Rat Terriers.
customer_reviews.author: M.B.

customer_reviews.title: My Dogs Like It
customer_reviews.text: My dogs love these. Easy for them to carry in their mouths and durable.
customer_reviews.author: lablovr00

customer_reviews.title: Ridiculously durable
customer_reviews.text: This was our dogs first toy and is still going strong. She regularly chews straight through beef neckbones. Get this toy, it smells awesome as well.
customer_reviews.author: JamminWithAkira

customer_reviews.title: Smells great and bounces around
customer_reviews.text: My puppy normally destroys almost any toy within minutes. We've already had this one for a few weeks! Smells great and bounces around, so it's fun for him to chase.
customer_reviews.author: Christina

customer_reviews.title: My dogs love these. They float great and we play with ...
customer_reviews.text: My dogs love these. They float great and we play with them in the pool all summer long. Great durability.
customer_reviews.author: Mary West

customer_reviews.title: The BEST
customer_reviews.text: I find these Ruff Dawg peanuts to be the BEST time-occupying toys for dogs. Our dog (25 lb - 2 year old mutt) loves this toy, and hasn't destroyed it yet. They are so strong and durable.
customer_reviews.author: Jennifer Stark

customer_reviews.title: this is a great toy! I never get toys or balls that ...
customer_reviews.text: If your dog likes to swim or fetch and is medium size or over, this is a great toy! I never get toys or balls that are small enough to somehow swallow. Also, if the dog has sensitive or worn-down teeth, this one is soft and light-weight but strong. This peanut is great fun!
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Tougher than a bulldog
customer_reviews.text: Our english bulldog loves this toy and it has survived her powerful jaws for a long time which is very impressive!
customer_reviews.author: Christina Harris

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: My pups loves this, chases it and drags it all over house.
customer_reviews.author: Dorothy Gallardo

customer_reviews.title: I got these (the second one for Christmas) for my ...
customer_reviews.text: I got these (the second one for Christmas) for my Daughters dog and was concerned initially the first time thinking they would be too big for such a small dog. It has been the longest lasting toy she has withstanding her sharp little teeth! It has been one of her favorites!
customer_reviews.author: kathleen franck

customer_reviews.title: Nor cool to advertise one thing and send another
customer_reviews.text: My dog loves this toy. But i did not receive a bright orange one thats pictured. The one I received is a bland honey/dirt/beige color. Nor cool to advertise one thing and send another.
customer_reviews.author: Trish Bakst

customer_reviews.title: Durable and nice smelling peanut
customer_reviews.text: Rubber has a nice vanilla smell which doesn't turn him off. It seems indestructible despite all the chewing it has gone through. Keeps him entertained for a good while which is great. It is rather big though, didn't expect that but my toy poodle can still hold onto it properly.
customer_reviews.author: PS Chow

customer_reviews.title: Wasn't a huge hit.
customer_reviews.text: My dogs liked it but didn't love it like they do their kongs. It appears sturdy but they don't play with it enough to tell just how strong..I will get them new Kongs.
customer_reviews.author: deirdre griffin

customer_reviews.title: This is awesome!
customer_reviews.text: Ok, it smells kind of gross like peanuts, but my dog is so happy whenever he gets this toy. He tears up kong toys (border collie manic energy) but hasn't even made a tooth mark on this? It's not that it's all that strong looking but he loves squishing it? I don't know, I'm not a dog, I just know a happy dog when I see one.
customer_reviews.author: J. L. R

customer_reviews.title: junk
customer_reviews.text: My dog chewed it apart in 1 HR.. I dont get all the good reviews
customer_reviews.author: A.D.

customer_reviews.title: Very durable, loved by all 3 dogs.
customer_reviews.text: We have had this toy for almost 3 months now, seems to be very durable and loved by all 3 dogs.
customer_reviews.author: Tina

customer_reviews.title: My dog loves this thing
customer_reviews.text: she plays with it all the time looking for the treats inside. this toy is a great tough dog product.
customer_reviews.author: Sean Gallagher

customer_reviews.title: Head over heals about her toy
customer_reviews.text: My Lab loves to play with her peanut. It is her favorite toy and takes it every where she goes, even to bed!!
customer_reviews.author: MP

customer_reviews.title: It is very sturdy. He is a toy killer and we have ...
customer_reviews.text: My lab/Pit mix loves this. It is very sturdy. He is a toy killer and we have now had it for 7 months, longest lasting toy so far.
customer_reviews.author: Russ Cram

customer_reviews.title: Peanut - very disappointed
customer_reviews.text: I am very disappointed in the durability of this product. My son's dog started tearing it apart in about 20 minutes. I thought it was supposed to be much more durable. We also bought a rubber fish which IS indestructible so far (after 4 weeks).
customer_reviews.author: Matthew

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: My dog LOVES this and best part is he can't through it!
customer_reviews.author: Robby

customer_reviews.title: Four Stars
customer_reviews.text: Its really nice but my dogs are not very interested in it unless it has the treats in it.
customer_reviews.author: Benjamin Hartford

customer_reviews.title: Lives up to its name RUFF!
customer_reviews.text: Took 3 to the Dog Park in Wisconsin and the dogs really liven up playing with them. 20 dogs and owners meet there every morning and after 1 month of use all 3 Peanuts are in great shape. Of course we do not insert treats when using them at the Park. Several dog owners have purchased them to use at home. No negative comments!
customer_reviews.author: Marilyn Fouad

customer_reviews.title: Fun for all!
customer_reviews.text: My yorkie beagle mix loves his peanut. He prefers his kibble served via peanut. He brings it to me at mealtime. Hard to fill, but fun to watch.
customer_reviews.author: Country Girl

customer_reviews.title: Product is different than before. Not as strong
customer_reviews.text: We've purchased a Ruff Dawg Peanut in the past and it was very durable. The material on this new one was more flexible or soft and didn't last 2 weeks. My dog pretty much ate it.
customer_reviews.author: Connie Dewey

customer_reviews.title: One Star
customer_reviews.text: Lasted about 5 minutes. Dogs chewed it to pieces not worth the cost.
customer_reviews.author: Becky

customer_reviews.title: Not for a strong jaw
customer_reviews.text: Our lab chewed it through in 2 mins. Wouldn't recommend it to other dogs who have strong chews.
customer_reviews.author: Yun-chan Tsai

customer_reviews.title: I recieved this Peanut yesterday. And it's lasted through ...
customer_reviews.text: I recieved this Peanut yesterday. And it's lasted through the night. Most toys barely last 10minutes with my 7 month old GSP, and 5 month old husky. It smells delicious, I got the pink one. Will be ordering another shortly.
customer_reviews.author: Ron Hacker

customer_reviews.title: Maybe good for small dogs/
customer_reviews.text: My Labrador and GSP's had it destroyed in less than five minutes. It was basically a waste on money. Beware/
customer_reviews.author: Candace W. Almquist

customer_reviews.title: Perfect for your ruff chewer
customer_reviews.text: This large peanut has been the only toy my dog has not been able to chew through. I now have 4 of them because they are the only toys we can keep around the house. She has been able to chew through everything else.
customer_reviews.author: sarahmathteacher

customer_reviews.title: LOVE LOVE LOVE  IT!
customer_reviews.text: Have a very active Beabull that plays day and night. This is our second peanut and his favorite toy. Love the bounce, the smell, and the fact that if you throw it and your aim is off a bit it dosen't ruin the furniture
customer_reviews.author: Cherie  Illner

customer_reviews.title: Not for really Ruff Dawgs
customer_reviews.text: Very soft, easily torn to pieces by my Chessie. Didn't last more than a few minutes. I won't be buying this brand again.
customer_reviews.author: Catherine Cogley

customer_reviews.title: Not for agressive chewers!
customer_reviews.text: Had this out of the package 10 minutes before our lab mix had a chunk chewed off. Very disappointed as I was looking for something he could chew without constant supervision.
customer_reviews.author: Shane

customer_reviews.title: My dog who distroys every toy I bring into the ...
customer_reviews.text: My dog who distroys every toy I bring into the house, this one has made it the longest. Its durable and you can fill it with treats.
customer_reviews.author: Lisa Phillips

customer_reviews.title: Not durable. It was ripping at the end within ...
customer_reviews.text: Not durable. It was ripping at the end within a day.
customer_reviews.author: bkatsp1

customer_reviews.title: Cute but not so Ruff.
customer_reviews.text: My pit bull absolutely loved this -- its soft, hollow rubber, with a nubby surface. Alas - it lasted about 5 minutes. Too bad -- for comparison, she does not destroy red Kongs or her Squirrel dude, but makes short work of a tennis ball and pretty much any highly flexible hollow chew toy.
customer_reviews.author: ProfessorMom

customer_reviews.title: Ruff Dawg Peanut
customer_reviews.text: Kona loved her previous peanut toy so much she chewed a hole in the end. Santa was asked to bring her a new one in Ismaning Germany. It got there in time for her to enjoy it on Christmas.
customer_reviews.author: C. B. Halter

customer_reviews.title: Two Stars
customer_reviews.text: My dog chewed this up in a matter of minutes
customer_reviews.author: cher sukosd

customer_reviews.title: Lasted less than 1 hour!
customer_reviews.text: Not worth it for power chewers. My dog ate the top half of the peanut off the first time I gave it to him.
customer_reviews.author: Lisa K.

customer_reviews.title: Ruff Dawg Peanut
customer_reviews.text: It is the only toy that last longer than a week with my dachshund. It also smells good enough to keep him interested.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Great toy
customer_reviews.text: My dog is a chewer who shreds cloth toys. This is the only toy she has not destroyed. I bought two in case she destroys one and put the second one away as it is extremely durable. I like that it is made in the USA.
customer_reviews.author: PetLover

customer_reviews.title: Great toy.
customer_reviews.text: My dogs usually shreds all toys.This is the 2nd one we have had in 3 years. Great toy.
customer_reviews.author: Ceej

product_meta.title: Ruff Dawg Peanut Rubber Dog Toy Assorted Neon Colors
product_meta.description: Everyone loves a giant peanut! The Peanut toy from Ruff Dawg is is made of premium rubber - it's bouncy, textured, and can be filled with small treats or kibble. The Peanut floats in water, so your dog can play fetch in the pool, lake or at the beach. Medium to large size dogs love to carry around this barbell-shaped toy that's springy and gentle on teeth & gums. Can be strung on a rope for distance throwing or to use as a tug toy. Peanut is perfect for cute photo-ops! Assorted bright neon colors for high visibility. Lightly peanut-scented. All Ruff Dawg toys are 100% Made safe in the USA of recyclable, FDA-approved materials, free of phthalates, latex and BPAs. Ruff Dawg is a family owned company that has been keeping dogs fit and active with premium quality Made-in-the USA toys since 1998.
feature_bullets: 6 inch tall rubber retrieving toy for medium to large size dogs.
Textured, can be filled with treats or kibble, gentle on teeth and gums, barbell shape dogs love to carry.
Floats in water for fetching in pool, lake or at the beach, string on a rope for distance throwing and tugging.
100% Made in the USA of FDA-approved recyclable materials, free of phthalates, latex, and BPAs.
Assorted bright neon colors for high visibility.
